message.p: High quality - Further research is very unlikely to change our confidence in the estimate of effect
Moderate quality - Further research is likely to have an important impact on our confidence in the estimate of effect and may change the estimate
Low quality - Further research is very likely to have an important impact on our confidence in the estimate of effect and is likely to change the estimate
Very low quality - Any estimate of effect is very uncertain
The standardized mean difference (SMD) is: (difference in mean outcomes)/(standard deviation of mean outcome)
The 'standardization' allows pooling of different types of outcomes.
